title: Lesson 1: Hello World
text: The classic first line of code. Use print() to show a message.

title: Lesson 2: Variables
text: Variables store data. You can assign strings or numbers to them.

quiz.question: Which is a valid variable name?

title: Lesson 3: Numbers
text: Python supports integers and floats. You can do math with them.

title: Lesson 4: Strings
text: Strings are text wrapped in quotes. Use + to combine them.

title: Lesson 5: Input
text: Use input() to get information from the user.
project:
name = input('What is your name? ')
print('Hello, ' + name)

title: Lesson 6: Comments
text: Use # for single-line comments to describe your code.

title: Lesson 7: Booleans
text: Booleans represent True or False values.

title: Lesson 8: Comparisons
text: Use comparison operators like ==, !=, <, >.

title: Lesson 9: If Statements
text: Use if to make decisions in your code.

title: Lesson 10: Else
text: Use else to run code when if is False.

title: Lesson 11: Elif
text: Elif lets you check multiple conditions.

title: Lesson 12: Lists
text: Lists store multiple values in one variable.

quiz.question: What symbol is used for lists?

title: Lesson 13: Loops
text: Use for loops to repeat code for items in a list.

quiz.question: What does a for loop do?

project:
for i in range(3):
  print('Loop:', i)

title: Lesson 14: While Loops
text: While loops run while a condition is true.

quiz.question: When does a while loop stop?

title: Lesson 15: Functions
text: Functions let you reuse code easily.

title: Lesson 16: Parameters
text: Parameters let you pass data into functions.

title: Lesson 17: Return
text: Use return to get results from a function.

title: Lesson 18: Scope
text: Scope is where your variable exists.

quiz.question: Where is a variable from inside a function valid?

title: Lesson 19: Dictionaries
text: Dictionaries store key-value pairs.

title: Lesson 20: Nesting
text: You can nest lists and dictionaries.

title: Lesson 21: Import
text: Use import to access modules and libraries.

title: Lesson 22: Max Function
text: The max() function returns the largest item.
